instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V_G3H: What is PP3V_G3H? This is a typo of PP3V3_G3H When you see PP3V_G3H, assume they meant to type PP3V3_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
Hi!

No power, no fan spin.

Board looks in good shape, no corrosion.

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 20v
<SIGNAL>PP3V_G3H</SIGNAL> 3v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.7v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3v
L7030 12.6v
L7230 0v
L7210 0V
L7430 0V
L8102 0.995 V

I don't know what else to measure. thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
How the failure appeared?

Do you get voltage at L7290?
Also check <CHIP>U8210</CHIP>/20/40 output voltage.

You should try DFU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 100635, member: 682"]
How the failure appeared?

Do you get voltage at L7290?
Also check <CHIP>U8210</CHIP>/20/40 output voltage.

You should try DFU.
[/QUOTE]



How the failure appeared? 
R/ I just got it like that. no signs of life.

L7290   0V

<CHIP>U8240</CHIP>  
pin 1   0V
pin2    0v   
pin3   0v
pin4    0v
pin5    0v
pin 6    0v
pin 7     0.250 
pin 8     0.0
the reason im showing a picture edited with voltages is because on the Board view the ic's have 2 pads less.

im not sure how to DFU

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No power
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/DFU_Mode_Restore_(Macs)[/URL]

I said to check output voltage on the 3 mentioned chips; not checking all the pins!
